author: starwarsman52
title: Greatest clone figures imaginable!
review:
I couldn't believe how good these new clone figures were even after looking at pictures of them hundreds of times. The clone commander is fantastic. He has an awesome, almost transparent green/yellow color scheme which looks amazing. The 2 bomb squad troopers are perfect as well. The have an eye-popping hot orange color that also has a semi-transparent look to it. And the ARF trooper- INCREDIBLE! This has to be my favorite clone figure of ALL time. As for the BARC speeder, well a slight disappointment but not the worst. It's build is obviously easy to make but it's a kind of stupid way to put it together.
  • Pros:
  • incredible minifigures
  • good price

  • Cons:
  • mediocre speeder
  • thats it!

author: CapnRex101
title: 7913 - Clone Trooper Battle Pack
review:
This set is absolutely incredible in every way, from the figures to the speeder, I love it all! 

Box/Instructions

The box for the set features the BARC speeder surrounded by Clone troopers on a sort of jungle background. Laser blasts are all around, presumably from some droids or possibly the new Mandalorians.

The instructions are just fine, no errors or missing pieces for me!

Parts

The parts for this set are excellent, especially the parts which make up the wonderful figures, the ARF trooper helmet is a new mould and the other three helmets have all got brand new printing! The speeder is made up of some very nice parts, such as the ski pieces which form the four sections of armour plating (if that is what they are) protecting the blasters and the engines.

Minifigures

Well now, this is where the set comes together spectacularly. All the figures in the set are fantastic. I will start with the brilliant ARF trooper, the helmet design is really spectacular, better than that of Arealight in my opinion. The printing is spot on and looks really nice. The Clone trooper is in fact from Horn Company led by Captain Lock under the command of Jedi general Eeth Koth, they appear in the season two episode 'Grievous Intrigue' and the figure looks very accurate to it's brief appearance in the TV show. This figure includes leg printing unlike most Clone figures, as does the Bomb Squad trooper figure. This figure has a very nice helmet (which is interestingly orange with white printing and not the other way around) which looks just like the helmet of the Bomb Squad trooper from the season one episodes 'Blue Shadow Virus' and 'Mystery of a Thousand Moons' as does the torso and leg printing. And just to sweeten the deal, you get two of these!

The build

The build is very quick and easy, it takes between five and ten minutes and contains no difficult or particularly interesting building techniques.

The completed model

The figures as I so emphatically stressed are excellent, but so is the speeder, it is predominantly white but also includes some green and dark grey parts. It is very accurate to both the bikes seen in Revenge of the Sith and those seen in the Clone Wars. I prefer this bike to the one which appears in the Republic Gunship set from 2008.

Summary

Overall as you may have guessed I absolutely adore this set, everything about it is perfect and I will definitely be buying multiples of this set to bolster my Clone army.


Overall - 10/10

author: Carl
title: Clone Trooper Battle Pack
review:
This was my first set of the 2011 Star Wars sets, and I am very happy with it indeed.

Minifigures


All of these minifigures are unique to this set. They are a new Clone Commander with some lime/sand green markings, two orange and white Bomb Squad Troopers and, my favourite, the new ARF Trooper. They are all very cool minifigs and pull the score up quite considerably.

BARC Speeder


The BARC Speeder has been redesigned since last time it was includded in a LEGO set (7261 Clone Turbo Tank) and is the perfect addition to this battle pack. It has green markings along the sides and four white skis as well. The build is interesting and the overall speeder is very sturdy. 

Pros and Cons


Pros:
  • - New Clone Commander
  • - Bomb Squad Troopers
  • - ARF Trooper
  • - BARC Speeder
Cons:
  • - I would've liked another component (maybe a turret?..)

Price


$17.50 (NZD) is a pretty good price for a set with minifigs like these!

Overall


Overall this is a very good set, and I would recommend getting a few of them purely to build up a Clone Army. I am very pleased indeed that I bought it.

author: tommy216a
title: One to get for the Minifigs!
review:
This weekend, I picked up 2 Lego Star Wars sets. The Battle of Naboo and a Clone Trooper Battle Pack. I built this one first and immediately realized that I should get more.

Box/Instructions

The box has the Captain Rex Logo on it and shows 4 all new minifigs on the front. On the back, it shows this battle pack an battle with the Mandolorian Battle Pack(which I will get). The instructions show the new Lego Star Wars Winter sets.

Parts

The parts are nice and I count the minifig parts in the rating.There are 2 Lego Atlantis Spear Guns in this set. There was 1 extra piece and that was a black bent droid arm.

Minifigures

The minifigs make this set amesome! All of them are new. You get a new ARF Trooper. Unfortunetly, the only thing new about him is his helmet, but the helmet is the best one I've ever seen. You can turn it 360 degrees. It has tons of details. The new Clone Commando(on the box it says clone trooper) has green printed legs, green printed body, and a green printed helmet. It also has 2 new commando pistols (the set also has 2 blaster rifles and 1 blaster pistol). Lastly, you get 2 new Bomb Squad Troopers. They both have legs, arms, bodies, and helmets that are printed orange.

The build

There nothing important really about the build.

The completed model

The Speeder Bike has some nice colors (green and white) and looks very cool with the Clone Commando on it.

Summary

I give this set a 4 1/2 out of 5 because the price is not good ($12) but you should still get it for the all new minifigs.

author: Roketah
title: No Mission To Great For The Clone Wars BARC Speeder
review:
This set is great last night i got this set along with the snowtrooper pack. ill say now that this set is packed with 2 of the best figures lego has ever made.

 Pros

  • Unidentifed Soldier That We Call Legion Trooper (the green one)
  •  ARF Trooper (the main reason to get this set)
  •  very sturdy speeder and very stable
  •  smart use of the harpoons
  •  Clone Decals
  •  new pistols

 Cons

  • 2 bomb squad troopers!! seriously recks the set
  • cant army build

Finish

all and all, this is a neat set but loses a point because half the soldiers are useless. 4/5

author: Watto115
title: Clone TROOPER Battlepack
review:
Nice battlepack but with cons. Here are the pros and cons

Pros

ARF Trooper

Bomb Squad Trooper

Legion Trooper

Better speeder than first clone battlepack

New Pistols

Cons

ARF Trooper has a bland body

No regular clone troopers

 

 

Overall a good battlepack but not to build your army because of no regular clone troopers

author: sudorum
title: Not a copy-cat pack
review: So another battle pack comes around. This particular one, as well as the mandalorian pack, are the best ones to come out. The speeder, thankfully, is not a complete rip- off of other speeders. It features a different build and a different color scheme. The four troopers are all new. The first one is adorned in green markings. Two others are a nice orange color and deviate from the typical mostly white clone trooper. The final trooper has a standard body, but his helmet is different. It's a more complex version of the helmets worn by the Endor troopers. Overall, good for minifigs, and an extra speeder if you feel you don't have enough already.

author: Brickmeister1138
title: Simply the best Specialist Clone Army Builder out There
review:
Overall, this set is fantastic, and it has two very well designed elements:

 

The BARC Speeder Bike: This set contains by far the best version of the BARC speeder bike Lego has released to date. The scaling and details on this version are far more accurate to both the version seen in Episode III and the version seen in Clone Wars.

 

The Clones: The clones in this set are truly fantastic, and are some of the most visually appealing clone troopers lego has released yet. The paint schemes on their armor even match the Clone Wars episodes precisely, especially the bomb squad troopers seen in "Blue Shadow Virus". The Helmet on the ARF trooper is also very accurate and well decorated. These clones seem to be a bit more "niche" than the clones in the last clone battle pack, but that does not make them any less awesome.

Pros

  • The Speeder Bike is Excellent
  • The decoration on the Clone Troopers is Fantastic
  • An ARF Trooper has finally been made!, though he lacks leg printing for some reason...
  • These minifigs allow one with a standing Clone Army to flesh out their ranks with some specialists

Cons

  • The leg printing on the clones in this set is a pro of course, but the ARF trooper and the older CW clones now look like they are missing something when they are put with the other new clones in this set due to the amazing decoration on the Bomb Squad Troopers and the Green Clone.
  • As I stated above, these clones are much more "niche" and specialized than the ones in the last clone battle pack (8014). Depending on where you are in the fan spectrum, this can either be a pro or a con. In terms of serving as an army builder, this set seems to be better suited to adding a bit of flavor to a standing clone army, while 8014 (the Clone Walker Battle Pack from 2009) makes a better bulk army bulder. One could even use the ARF trooper in the walker from that set!
  • A little expensive: $12 for me

Overall, This set is excellent. It may be a bit specialized, but it is still a must have for any fan of Lego and Star Wars. A solid 5/5.

author: legoclone
title: Always like to get more clones
review:
It's a pretty good battle pack and I always like getting clones.  The Barc Speeder is really nice and I am glad Lego finally gave us a good one.   

 

Here's a hint though people at Lego...when deciding what mini-figs to put in these battle packs it's always nice when you include at least 3 of the most common type contained in an army which gives your customers incentives to buy more in order to build up big armies.    That's why I bought multiple sets of the old clone trooper and stormtrooper battle packs because they had 3 common troopers each.  Heck, I bought 7 of the clone trooper sets and I'll probably buy that many of the Mandaloran sets.  But with this set I'll probably get only one because I don't really need an entire platoon of bomb disposal troopers.  If you had instead included one bomb trooper and 3 of either of the other types I would have bought a ton of these things.  Just something to consider...

author: Dark_raptor_88
review:
Pros

  •  brand new figs w/leg printing
  •  brand new barc speder`

Cons

    the arf trooper lacks leg printing

  • you can see orange coming out of the bomb squad trooper helmet                                                                       

 a must have for everyone even if you hate lego then why would someone who hates lego be on this site?

author: jango_e1_g3
title: clone troopers!
review:
Frist of yet another cool battle pack.

On to the minifigs.First the ARF trooper:The ARF trooper has a normal clone body,but the helmet is what rasied the bar.The helmet is clone wars stlye which is fine and looks great.There is a lot of detail on this thing which includes some blue marks on top and a red tooth thing.

The bomb squad troops:Ah, the smell of specilaty clones.There orange colored,with a kind of triangle shape on the chest and back,as well is on the helmet,and feature printed legs with he same design.I actully havent seen them on the show but im sure it was a epoisode I missed.

The commando:My personal favorite.He has a detailed chest with green marks and some yellowish mark,aswell as printed legs.His helmet is detailed the same way.Even his back has some green marks.Also he is armed with two duel pistols.This,unlike the previous,has a small scope on top!For some reason I like the old ones better.Also they look identical to Han Solos pistol!

The BARK speeder:Awsome!A nicely designed speeder that beats almost all the previous ones.Its about 7 inchs long,with frontal air intake and the rear has some air scopes antennae things(?) and fins.It sits one clone.I put the ARF trooper in the cockpit.It also has those neat handle bars.

Well thats it for this review.Almost forgot if you use the spare battle droid arm it comes with,you can clip it on one of the antennae things as a blaster rack.

author: wander099
title: One too many bomb squad...
review:
Box/Instructions

The box is nice, got some good pictures, but it's nothing special compared to the other sets in the 2011 star wars line.

Parts

Nothing really special here.  We've seen it all before.

Minifigures

With this set you get 4 minifigures: 1 ARF trooper, 2 bomb squad troopers, and 1 clone trooper with green markings.  The ARF trooper is great and is so far exclusive to this set and I like the clone with green markings as well, though I'm not sure why it has green markings it really looks nice.  My only problem with this aspect are the two bomb squad clones.  The printing on them is nice, but the fact that there are two of them, as opposed to having two ARFs or two of the clone with green markings, detracts from this set as an army builder and deterred me from buying more than one.

The build

The build was simple.  There were no difficult aspects or problems.

The completed model

Overall, I like the model.  The speeder is simple, but looks good and is sturdy.

Summary

I picked this set up for 14.99 CDN a couple of weeks ago.  Overall, I'd say that it is a pretty good value and the only problem I had with this set is the two bomb squad troopers, one of which would have been more than sufficient.  I would recommend this set if you want a few more clones, but I would not recommending buying more than one to build your army.

author: jezzatheshed
title: With some minor changes this could have been a Great set.
review:
I like these "value for money " sets and this years Clones are on the whole worthwhile.

Pros

  • The ARF Trooper is just fantastic and worth the money alone.
  • The long butt grip on the blaster rifle means the troopers can hold them across the chest.

Cons

  • Who are the bomb clones? With a little less paint on the helmet they would 212th attack battalion as seen on Utapau in the movie, but the figures are supposed to be based on the cartoon series arn't they? I'm settling on 212th attack battalion.

The set is of excellent standard and I think the Barc Speeder is actually very accurate considering its made of simple bricks.

author: Duckuss_Maxximus
title: 7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack - Send In The Bomb Squad!!
review:
Okay so not very much to this set. Great figures. BARC Speeder Bike. I like the ARF Trooper the most! XD He looks cool on top of any of the Walker-class armaments. They should've thrown a 30006-1 Clone Walker in for him. The Ordnance Specialists/Bomb Squad are great. No bombs though. :( The clone commander is cool too. The Bright Green is an interesting color scheme. Hand blasters are always a plus. The speeder bike is nice. I prefer the one from The Battle of Geonosis (7869) but I guess if you wanted you could make these any color if you had the right bricks.

Pros 

  • Great set of Minifigures
  • BARC speeder

Cons  

  • No ordnance for Bomb Squad
  • No printed legs or vehicle for ARF Trooper

Overall this is a decent stand-alone set or can easily be added to any number of the Clone Wars sets.

author: THX_1138
title: Possibly my favorite battle pack yet
review:
Parts

Pretty good. Nothing special or rare, but lots of things that I, and I suppose probably others, use a lot.

Minifigures

The real reason to get the set, as usual with BPs. The bomb squad troopers are quite nice, although the white on their helmets doesn't look very good, but that's a relatively minor complaint. The Horn Company trooper is pretty good. The ARF trooper's new helmet is amazing, with great printing. All but the ARF trooper have great leg printing. These are possibly the best BP figures yet.

The Build

Average. Quite quick, and you could probably do it without looking at the instructions.

The Completed Model

It's not bad, but I instantly dismantled it to use its parts on my own version of the speeder. I really don't like how they did the side engines, and the way they're attached to the body. I also would've preferred lime green instead of normal green.

Summary

I would definitely get this for the minifigs if nothing else.

author: legoman831
title: The Republic's Newest Squad!
review:
This is the 7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack which comes 85 pieces and retailes for $11.99.  This set comes with 4 minifigures and a BARC speeder.  The piece-per-price ratio is not good because it is 14 cents per price.  I wish the price was $9.99, but there are 4 excellent minifigures which made it worth the $2 extra. Let's get right to the set. 

The Build.  (5/5)

It was super easy; it took my kids 7 minutes to build.  There was no mistakes in the intructions. 

The Parts.  (5/5)

It get some good parts like the guns on the speeder and the ice skates. 

The Minifigures.  (5/5)

These are some of my favorite minifigures.  First, you get the clone commander (or the Eeth Koth trooper).  He is cool!  He has some great green and yellow printing on the helmet and the body (and back printing which all of them have),and legs.  He has two small guns and the standard clone trooper head which all of them have.  Secondly, you get two awesome bomb squad troopers.  This is my favorite minifigures of the set.  One comes with a short gun and the other with a long gun.  They have excellent orange printing on their head and body and legs.  These look awesome!  Last but not least is the ARF trooper.  He carries a long gun.  His helmet mold and printing is excellent!  It looks awesome.  He has standard clone trooper armor printing.  Overall, these are excellent minifigures to collect for a clone trooper army. 

The Ship.  (4/5)

The small BARC speeder is great.  It has an awesome look.  The design is excellent.  It has small guns in the front and on top of the speeder.  You can sit a clone on a 2 by 2 brick space and connect his hands to the controls.  It has three landing gear pieces under it.  "Swooshbility" is excellent.  However, if you really want playability, you will need to buy the 7914 Mandalorian Battle Pack for $12 much. 

The Value.  (4/5)

The price is $11.99 for 85 pieces.  It is 14 cents a pieces which is poor.  But for what you get, it is good.  On the other hand, if you were building a big clone army, you probably need to buy some battle packs at a Buy One Get One 50% discount. 

The Summary. 

Overall, this is extremely good set.  It has two problems:  the price and the playability.  The price could have been $9.99 like the old battle packs, and for the playability, you need buy $12 more for the 7914 Mandalorian Battle Pack with 4 Mandalorians to battle the clones.  It has excellent figures.  In my opinion, I think this is the best battle pack in LEGO STAR WARS history (1999-2012).  Overall rating:   23/25

author: Orthobotrex
title: The troopers with a BIG BARK! ARF! ARF!!
review:
I'm more of a minifig collector, especially SW-OT troopers.

I find the clone minifigs wanting, especially the helmets: they're too simple, in my opinion. I can live with the faces, though. And I'm not a big fan of the Clone Wars series as well.

But then, adding color and prints to the rest of the figs in this set gave me a big surprise.

 

MINIFIGS

 

The gem of the lot: the ARF trooper!

     You just got to love the mold of the helmet. Mine had slight misprints on the mouth part (which hapens to a lot, as I have acquired new, loose figures of these babies), but that didn't dampen my enthusiasm for this thing. I really wish they placed 2 of these instead of the bomb squad troopers. You can't have enough of them, in my opinion. And whatever the rest of it's body lacks in terms of prints and colors, it makes up for with its helmet. Although this makes me want to swap the heads with the clone commander's, and you do get a more awesome fig which adds to the playability. I do pity him for not being the one assigned to ride the bike! AND even if he belongs to the clone wars, I'd be more than happy to put him side-by-side with the OT Stormies and scout troopers any day.

     The set also comes with two bomb squad troopers. The orange color give them such distinctive features, that seem to say, "we are here!", so that they should be easily sighted and be shot at (can we blame the republic for that?). Bomb disposal is another matter, though. Kidding aside, overall they are visually impressive, but I just do not agree with the colors for the roles. But these would be great for customization. The prints on the legs make up for a lot good points . The colors make them nice for display, as it easily catches the eye! ;-)

     The clone trooper commander also shows what additional colors and prints can do to improve appearance. I only wish that they fitted him at least with a rangefinder. I do like the touch of green on this thing, and the guns provided are an improvement from that of the previous battle pack. Prints on its legs are also a good addition. Add a pauldron and a kama and, "voila"! Another great customization piece!

 

SPEEDER BIKE

     The speeder bike is awesome, to say the least. It was a delight to build for me and the instructions are very direct. If there were choppers in the empire, this could be one of those. It's big, bad (in the good sense) and well designed! Everything fits in just right. It's very swooshable (at a lower altitude, of course!) and also aesthetically pleasing, as the newer designs of the vehicles seem to be becoming.The parts used are also a plus factor as most have a great degree of usability in other builds, if you consider such things. I give this also a big playability factor.

 

   Overall, this thing won't disaapoint you.

author: legodude357
title: One of the best
review:
This is a close second for my favorite battle pack. Its my only 2011 battle pack, I have yet to get multiples of it or the mando pack.

 

The box is alright, kinda eye catching really. The instructions, were, as always, flawless and had a smal picture of the mado pack and this one fighting, as well as an advertisment for other star wars sets.

 

The speeder. Ummmm...... It is really cool. Pretty good design and fun to build. Although as expected its just basically stacking plates then a few details. The original clone battle pack had a two man speeder which was much more playable and simplistic. This one is better for display. Sadly the price has been raised $3 USD. Please Lego, Battle Packs should be $9.99!! I would be able to buy so many more if they were!

 

Figures, oh my! The ARF trooper is beautifully painted (or printed? At least its not a sticker!) The ARF trooper is now the leader of my two imperial scout troopers from the Battle of Endor set.  Also, with the release with the Geonosian Starfighter around the corner, that commander cody figure can be the leader of the two orange clones. Who are supposed to be bomb squad. The last figure is what I've been told, is an 'Eth Coth Trooper'. Sorry for the spelling. He has double printed torso and printed legs! I put these legs and torso on the Arf trooper and it looks amazing!

 

This set yoyu will defeintly buy, because it is one of the cheaper sets of 2011. I think that the price can be lowered $3. I plan on buying many multiples of this set. But the mando battle pack, you should only get two of. Really you dont need more than eight mandos and maybe a boba fett to lead them. I would reccomend this to all Lego fans!

author: The_Guy_With_The_Bricks
title: Attack of the Pretty Orange Clones!
review:
Recently I picked up the two new Lego Star Wars Battle Packs: 7913 Lego Clone Troopers and 7914 Lego Mandalorian Battle Pack. Though I’m not a big fan of the Star Wars prequels, or the “Clone Wars” TV show, I have to admit that Lego does a phenomenal job creating Lego sets designed around them. The new Clone Troopers battle pack is a useful army builder to anyone who collects Lego Star Wars characters. Even though I am not a huge fan of the source material, I felt compelled to pick up this set because of the great clone trooper minifig design.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/legoclonetroopers.jpg[/img]

In my opinion the best element of the set is the ARF trooper, pictured below. The ARF (Advanced Recon Force) trooper is one of the baddest looking Star Wars minifigs ever. In the Star Wars mythology, these clone troopers were tasked with scouting enemy positions and carrying out surprise attacks.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/scaryclonetrooper.jpg[/img]

This year has seen the introduction of the new mini blasters (as seen above), a great new Star Wars weapon. Blasters have developed quite a bit from the start of the Lego Star Wars line, and this revision has produced the best representation of blasters at the right scale size.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/trooperonspeeder.jpg[/img]

The new BARC speeder bike is improved over the last one TLG released, and is more accurate to the movies and TV show. This identical speeder can also be found in the 7869 Battle for Genosis set.

For my full review including more pictures, please visit www.brick-building-ideas.com/lego-clone-troopers.html.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/mandysvsclonies.jpg[/img]

Here is a pic of a battle between the new Lego Mandalorian Battle Pack and the Clone Trooper Battle Pack, with Boba Fett thrown in for fun. I know the timeline is wrong, so don’t freak out on me, that’s the fun of Legos.

author: Firox_5000
title: New Clones
review:
I bought this set shortly after it came out from Lego.

 

The set contains 85 pieces and is very easy and quick to build which should take around 10-15 minutes at the most.

The set when completes consists of four clones and a speeder. The Clone figure are very well printed and I think the orange squad troopers are done very well. The sand green clone is also a nice addition as to is the bomb trooper adding some nice variation that the first clone battle pack did not really have.

The speeder is also a rather nice addition differening from the old mini walker from the 2009 one. It does the job well with colouring and appearance but is more of a supporter to the set to the figures to add playability, excitement and value.

The set contains several unique parts and colourings all on the clone troopers such as the orange printing and helmets on the bomb squad troopers, the turquise printing on the sand green clone trooper and the somewhat classic/clone cross in the  ARF trooper. Apart from that, all the other parts in the set are mostly common in other sets.

The playability of the set on it's own is quite durable however if you own the Mandalorian battle pack then the set has greater abilities of play value due to the opposing sides of a battle field.

This set is fantastic for the figures and it's low price tag offering many fans of lego to stock up on several of these for their collection and also it's unique figures.

There is nothing much I can complain about this set at all. The price I bought it at was £9.99 which at the time was quite good value. However to reflect the recent hike in this years battle packs the price has had a 20% hike of £2 making the current price of it now £11.99.

I very strongly recommend this set especially for all star wars fans, army builders and those who like clone trooper but dont like star wars. However for £12 a pack, I suggest where possible to buy them slightly reduced as it's previous price at £10 was much more reasonable.

author: Shistavanen_brick
title: Great pack of clones...
review:
This is a very nice set, which is very minifigure-heavy in a sense. I probably like these better than the 50/50 battle packs for 2012 just for that reason, that you in that case only get 2 from each army/team. These are better army-builders in my opinion. With 85 pieces you get much out of the clone army!

Minifigures.


Two bomb squad clones are included, which are nicely coloured in bright orange (like some nacho dip-sauce!). Markings on them are no different from the average clone I guess, but the way the colours are placed makes them rather cool. 

Then there's a sand green clone (commander?) with a nice yellow symbol on the front of the torso. 

But the best one is by far the ARF trooper. The helmet is just A1 in every aspect, another thing that makes it even cooler is to switch helmets between the green clone and the ARF. It actually looks better.

All of them have blasters. It would be cool with some new mold for clone weapons.

Speeder.


My impression after building it is that it's sleek and maybe unsteady on purpose. It might skid easier if you're playing with it and decide to make an u-turn. I'm not quite sure about why they've placed harpoon guns on the back top though. Although that might seem perfectly clear for someone else.

Conclusion.


This is a great set and a multiple buy will get your army going in no time. Get them while they last!



Pros:
  • Great value with four clones, especially as they are different (mind their clone-heads).
  • The ARF trooper is so darn cool!
Cons:
  • Maybe it should have been cheaper. On second thought, it must be cheaper! Come on LEGO....

author: Seagull
title: Fantastic Variety!
review:
Review for Set 7913-1: Clone Trooper Battle Pack

Great BARC speeder and a brilliant variety of clones, which is also a con is some ways...

 

Pros:

  • ARF trooper is great! His helmet is super cool, and can completely rotate unlike the Scout-Troopers helmet from the Battle Of Endor and other sets. The helmet also has pretty cool printing.
  • 2 bomb squad troopers, which can be used as clones for Obi-Wan Kenobi's army.
  • 1 Clone commander with very cool printing
  • BARC bike is fantastic, my favorite part of the set along with the Arf trooper!!

Cons:

  • Since all but 2 of the 4 clones in this set are different, it doesn't seems right when you have all kinds of different clones. Two basic clones would've been better than the two bomb-squad troopers.
  • Clone's head's were still the same. Hopefully there will be a change soon for some variety.

Overall:

Super cool set, and I highly recommend buying it (though the price should really be lower...). Cool minifigures and speeder. Thanks for reading. :)

author: legobuilderstudios
title: Bomb the droids with this battlepack!
review:
Well here it is, a review of the 7913 clone trooper battle pack! I have to say this is a pleasing set, with a good amount of parts, but the highlight of this set would have to be the new ARF helmet! Now let's get on with the PROS/CONS list

Pros

  • A good amount of parts
  • New ARF helmet
  • Nice Clone with green markings
  • And good BARC speeder.

Cons

  • The white (which it is meant to be) on the bomb squad troopers helmet is pink?!
  • The ARF can have a misprinted visor...
More or less the PROs beat the CONS 4-2, so I have to say this set is really good! I would guarantee buying it!

author: LEGOSLUG
title: Thrash the Enemy with the Clone Trooper Battle Pack!
review:
Here's my review of the set LEGO Star Wars 7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack.

The Minifigures:

* Bomb Squad Clone Trooper: These have regular printing, but part of it is orange.
* Bomb Squad Clone Trooper: These have regular printing, but part of it is orange.

* Clone Trooper Commander:  This isn´t like other Commander figures, it has no kama or pauldron just a regular Clone Trooper, with jungle printing and 2 pistols.

* A.R.F. Trooper: In a word, Awesome. The unique thing about this figure, however, is that it has a standard clone torso, but an awesome new helmet, (just like the ones from the Battle of Ryloth Clone Wars episode).

The Build:

The build will take 10 mins max, but, there are notable features of this set.
First off, there are NO STICKERS, as other Star Wars sets do, and the selection of parts is good as well, brilliant for MOCs, and , When the build is finished, the set looks sleek a aorodynamic just like in the movies.

Pros:

* New Minifigures that aren´t dumb.
* New Design BARC Speeder.
* No Stickers.

Cons:

* No one to fight.
* No stand for the Figures.

Conclusion:

Get it. This set is a brilliant army builder, The unique figures are sweet, and the newly designed BARC speeder just takes the biscuit. A brilliant addition to your Star Wars collection, either for play or display. 5/5

LEGOSLUG
P.S. Please see my other reviews and bricklists.

author: Starguy
title: Clones!
review:
Pros of the set

Figures

weapons

Barc speeder

bomb squad troops

Cons of the set

Bit small

should of been more troops

overall good set

author: dforce
title: Clone Wars to the max!
review:
This is a neat looking little set. I love both the BARC speeder and the troopers.
It has a bunch of special bricks and minifigures.Okay, now onto the pros and cons:

Pros:

  • Realistic BARC speeder
  •          Commander:His olive green painting looks cool, He is commander Lock, leader of the Horn company, he appeared in :grievous intrigue        
  •                     Ordnance specialists:They go well with a garbage truck, they appeared in:    blue shadow virus
  • ARF trooper:He looks really cool, he supposed to be  Razor, leader of the                    lightning squad, he appears in: liberty of Ryloth

Cons:

  • Wobbly wings
  •          Long gun (I hate it!)
  •          Ugly orange helmet of the Ordnance troopers

Oh, and if you mix the ARC trooper's helmet with the commanders body, you get a really cool looking commando specialist

author: StratTone
title: Great set for the price!
review:
One of the better sets that are small.

Pros

  • Pro 1 : Usable vehicle and fun to build.
  • Pro 2 : What you get for the money is hard to beat with the amount of figures you get.

Cons

  • Con 1 : None

Over all I don't see how you can beat this set for the $11 price point.  Worst case you have a great and cheap army building set.

author: admiral_ackbar
title: Decent set for a decent price, with more than decent minifigs!
review:
The Clone Trooper battle pack is a fun little set with cool minifigs and a nice speeder..

Box/Instructions

The box is the standard battle pack size that we've all come to know with the usual Captain Rex box art showing the set in it's 'action' pose, along with the near essential explosions and blaster lasers. The instructions were clear (as always) and no mistakes as far as I could see; all the parts were in the box.

Parts

Speaking of parts, there are a couple of nice pieces, my favourite being the cool gun pieces that lie on the top of the engines. Other than that, there is nothing of real importance to mention other than the ski parts that attach to the sides.

Minifigures

The minifigures are the main draw in my opinion. They are superb! The set comes with four brand new minifigs (at the time of release); a clone commander who comes with two great blaster pistols and green stylings, an ARF trooper with an AWESOME helmet piece (Great job by Lego here!) but a regular clone body and legs, and two bomb squad troopers, who look really good. Four real nice minifigs here, so great for those building up an army or squadron.

The build

Nothing to say here but really simple and not challengng in any way, but young children might get some building fun from it. 

The completed model

The speeder looks really nice and can hold a minifig with ease. I don't know whether it is from the clone wars or if it is just a Lego random creation, but it's cool either way. It looks really fit for duty when the ARF tropper is riding it, though, so look out droids (or Mandalorians for 2011)!

Summary

So, to sum up, a great army builder or first set, but not a great set for more experienced builders, but the decision always lies with YOU whether to get it or not. I would get it.

author: JediAnakin
title: The Clones Are Here
review:
I recently purchased this set and decided to review it. 

Box/Instructions

The Box was not Amazing, Although the battle scene on the rear of the box was nice. The instructions were standard.

Parts

Most of the Parts were common, but some were quite nice.

Minifigures

The mini-figures are the reason you buy this set. The Clone Trooper is very good. The Bomb Squad Trooper minifigs are amazing. I hope they appear in more sets. Then you get to the star of the set- the ARF Trooper. Such an amazing Minifigure. I would even be tempted to say it is one of the best of all time.

The build

The build is not hard, but rewarding at the end.

The completed model

The completed model is rewarding. Although the price is just £9.99 you get a lot. The 4 Minifigs+ The BARC Speeder makes it one of the best sets under £10!

Summary

Overall, I would recommend this set to anyone. The minifigures are frankly, AMAZING.
This set is THE best Battle Pack I have bought!
5/5!

author: legoreviewer266
title: The Best Battle Pack Until Now!
review:
Build: build was super easy, took me about 15 min to build and most of that was mainly assembling the mini figures. There isn't much else to talk about, but the speeder bike was definitely fun to build. Very sleek and good looking and I liked the different tactics they used for it.

Mini figures: You get 4, just like most the other battle packs and they are all exclusive (so far). You get an ARF Trooper, which is was makes this set perfect. The torso is unfortunately the same as a regular clone, but I just looooove the helmet! It's so well designed, very well moulded, not too tight or loose, just perfect and amazingly detailed. You also get 2x Bomb Squad Troopers, which are pretty cool as well. There helmets are a bit loose (especially if you play with it a lot) so just heads up on that. You also get a Clone Commander, but it doesn't say what region on the box. He is also really detailed, with 2 different high lights of green.

Set: There is nothing to really go on about the set. it's a good sized speeder, but it's really tippy. It keeps tipping to one side or the other and I really don't know why. You can easily slide a mini figures in it, to ride the speeder. It's also worth mentioning that you get a pair of NEW pistols for the Clone Commander, but when you put him on the speeder there is not really a place to hold it, or a storage compartment. 

Conclusion: The set is awesome, it's one of the best battle packs I've had and it's a great deal for 85 pieces and it's fantastic to either build armies, or just pick one up to collect the minifigures, especially the ARF Trooper!

Pros:

- Excellent value for money, 85 pieces for $12US

- 4 exclusive mini figures

- The ARF has a fantastic helmet, very well designed and moulded

Cons:

- No storage for the Clone Commander's pistols, when he is on the speeder bike

- The speeder bike tips over to either side, but it's a small set and it's easy to mod that...

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Clone Trooper Battle Pack Review
review:
This is a fun set to have and it' fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 24 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has a lot of great parts which you can use for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure. The piece which I like the most is the ARF-trooper helmet.

Minifigures

The minifigs are all awsome. My favourite one is the ARF-trooper and my second favourite figure is the bomb squad trooper. The helmet of the ARF-trooper has a very cool design and the helmets for the bomb squad troopers are awsome as well. I like the printings on the torso and of the helmet as well.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't get any stickers to worry about.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7913-1.jpg[/img]


This set looks very nice and it is very sturdy as well. Even if it doesn't have and play features it is still very fun to maneuver and to build an army. I really can't complain about this set but I still wish that it would have included a turret, just like the one we've seen in the mandalorian battle pack, as well.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: frostlass
title: Green Company, A.R.F  Troopers and Bomb Squads, oh my!
review:
On my second to last review, I promised this review. So, here it is!


Building Experience: Seriously, not much to build. Just 4 clones and a speeder.
It's only got 85 pieces!


Parts: Parts are much better then building experience. The 4 clones consisting of
2 bomb squad troopers, a green company trooper, and an A.R.F trooper. The helmets of 
these troopers have been improved upon the regular clone trooper helmet. But the 
speeder doesn't have any special parts.

Playability: This is far by the best of the categories for this set.
You really can only play with the clones though. Sadly because the speeder Has no
features. As for 9488, You at least get a missile launching function and poseable legs.


Value For Money: I'd say a little overpriced. $12.99 seems like a lot for a 
Little set like this one. For 9488, $13.99 is also a little expensive, Because they raise the
battle pack price $1.00 every year!


Overall: So, this set in my opinion, Gets a 9/10.The Minifigures really kick up the score! I hope you enjoyed this review! XD

author: ScarVader
title: Finally, printed legs!
review:
This has got to be one of the best Battle Packs ever made! I'd rate this second best with 8014 Clone Walker Battle Pack being first. This set shows a major improvement for the Star Wars theme with the return of a wider scale use of printed legs and hips (Only the legs are printed in this set though).

Minifigures 

The minifigures are the best part of the set with new torso and helmet designs. The Bomb Squad Troopers are stunning with a completely orange moulded helmet with white and black printings to resemble the visors etc...

The Clone Trooper Commander is also stunning with green printings which could be used to make a Commander Gree minifigure.

The ARF Trooper on the other hand is the big let down about this set. This minifigure features a great helmet which is a brand new mould. The printed visor is precisely in line with the eyes of the minifigure wearing the helmet. The down side is that the torso is that of a standard ''Clone Wars'' Clone Trooper and so therefore has no extra markings to show rank or battalion to which he belongs to. He is also the only minifigure in the set with no leg printings.

Speeder Bike (BARC)

The Speeder Bike is basic in design and is simple to build. It features no rare or unique pieces. There are some flaws though in the design because when a minifigure is sat at the controls if it were to fire at the enemy it would shoot the handle bars off.

Pros 

Here are some pros about this set:

  • Printed legs to make the minifigures more realistic.
  • New blaster pistols with scopes.

Cons

Here are some cons about this set:

  • The ARF Trooper hasn't got printed legs.
  • The Clone's visors are smaller than the previous designs.
In conclusion the set is a great addition to any Clone army and a must have for the ARF Troopers!

author: Odeinoichus
title: The Clone Wars Continue
review:
Set #7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack: It's been a long time coming, but finally I'm going to review the last of the Star Wars sets I have yet to get reviewed. And what better sets to leave until the end than 2011's Battle Packs.

 

This set scores fairly high, while admittedly there is only one model to build, which is typical of LEGO Battle Packs, we get a lot of great items included in the set. To start off we'll mention the model, this is a BARC Speeder build, it is similar to other designs of the BARC speeder found in recent Star Wars sets. It makes however for a simple, fast build with some great design choices for the detail of the BARC, compared to older Speeders which were lacking in decent piece numbers used and details carried over from official media.

 

It is great for playing with and makes for a decent addition to the Vehicles your Kids or Diorama MOCer enthusiast AFOLs enjoy to make so much. It isn't as cluttered as the miniature Imperial Dropship from the 2009(?) Stormtrooper/Shadow Trooper battle pack, so you can easily hold onto it and swish it around.

 

Combine this Battle Pack with the previous Clone Wars styled Battle Packs and you can have a miniature battle/army to have fun with.

 

Now for the Mini-Figures. These four are impressive, you have great printed detailing on the Clones, in different and unique colors. We also get a brand new style of helmet with the ARF Trooper. Aesthetically these four Mini-Figures fit in with Clone Wars displays/collections, however they'll look great added in with any clone army.

 

The two Bomb Squad Troopers include new orange coloring, which makes some fun new printing and great troop buildable mini-figs. All four of the Clones have the exact same head, we also get more of the same Clone affiliated accessories we've seen in past sets. Two small pistols for the BARC Speeder Pilot, two long blaster rifles and an ordinary blaster.

 

All four of these Clones include back printing, if memory serves, and the bomb squad troopers have leg printing. Overall this is a must own set, and a perfect one for clone enthusiasts to buy multiples of. I rate it a solid five out of five, with exception to the build, which gets three out of five only because you aren't building much and if you collect a lot of Star Wars sets you'll have built a few of these BARC speeders before. I strongly reccomend this set.

author: AT_TE_is_so_cool
title: Bomb Squad troopers are amazing.
review: So far, this is one of the best battle packs if you are looking for good clone troopers, but is not the best if you are looking for a good vehicle. I would give the building experience two bricks because, there is a total of 85 pieces in this set, so there is only a little lego could let the speeder actually do. The minifigures are amazing, which include an ARF trooper, a horn company commander, and two AMAZING Bomb Squad troopers, which made me super happy. The only special parts found in the set are the two harpoon guns that make up the speeder's blasters, and the ARF trooper's helmet piece. But the printing for the figure's torsos and leg pieces make up for the lack of special parts included. The playability of the set is not that high, because the speeder can't really do much, which is probably one of the only faults in the set. I think the money is a small price to pay for this set, and I think it is worth every cent. All in all, I think this is a great set to have so you can grow your clone army and is a must get set from 2011. I definitely recommend this set for all Star Wars fans and clone wars lovers.

author: Captainfives1514
title: Clone Specialists
review:
I always wanted this set, so when someone gave it to me for Christmas one year I was extremely excited.

 Minifigures;

  ARF trooper this is the first LEGO ARF trooper. His helmet is a specially moulded piece with blue and green markings. His torso is printed with regular clone armour printing and plain white legs.

  Horn Company Commander he has sand green markings on his helmet and his torso with a stylised bull in lime green on his torso. With armour printing and sand green highlights.

  Two Bomb Squad troopers. They have orange helmets with a white diamond pattern on the faceplate. With orange and white printed on their legs and torsos.

  The only build in this set is a speeder bike for the clones to ride. This scale of a BARC speeder is my favourite version. The speeder is white with green markings. Overall it is a great set.
